intro: Mentha arvensis var. hostii, commonly known as the lemon balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, slightly lemon-scented leaves and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a soft, velvety texture, while its stems are square and hairy. Mentha arvensis var. hostii is often cultivated for its calming fragrance and used in herbal teas and aromatherapy.
